intro: Erigeron macrum, commonly known as the rough blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features hairy, gray-green leaves and produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Erigeron macrum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
